H0.text: Which motor company owns the truck maker, Scania. Volkswagen

H1.text: Which motor company owns the truck maker, Scania. Daimler

H2.text: Which motor company owns the truck maker, Scania. Volvo

H3.text: Which motor company owns the truck maker, Scania. SAAB

A4.text: Scania is a subsidiary of Traton, part of the Volkswagen Group.

A5.text: On 7 August 1999, Volvo announced it had agreed to acquire a majority share in Scania. The acquisition, for US$7.5 billion (60.7 billion SEK), would have created the world's second-largest manufacturer of heavy trucks, behind DaimlerChrysler.
